main event: An unidentified silver or chrome object, smaller than a DC-3 but larger than a cub plane, was observed spinning or traveling on a direct course at a great speed over South Bend, Indiana on October 13, 1948.
interesting points: The object was observed from the window of an office building and was in view for 5-10 seconds.
The object was moving at a speed approximately three times faster than a transport plane.
The object did not make any sound and left no trail.
The object faded from view rather than taking off.
The weather conditions were clear with average cloudiness.
sighted object: a silver or chrome, disc-shaped object
